title: Drawing, Sketchbook Page; Monument of Marcus Aurelius Antonius with Son; Study for an Engraving, ca. 1590
title_raw: Sketchbook Page; Monument of Marcus Aurelius Antonius with Son; Study for an Engraving
medium: pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on laid paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle. Reverse: A) Oblique view of a pedestal with an equestrian monument. Behind the horse stands a naked boy carrying a small sword in his left hand and a dead child upon his right shoulder. Caption: "Antonio/ un pidestalle con Sntonio filosofa padre e comodo/ figlilo nudo con spada in mano uno bambino in spala/ morte." B) At top, horizontally, the Crucifix is shown in the central part of an eleborate frame, beside the pediment of which fly angels. At left stands Eve, a naked woman, at right, a morning woman, Mary, or the Church. The Apostles with their attributes kneel in pairs, below, at left and at right. C) A bird's-eye view. The beds stand at the right long wall, one of them beside the door along the back wall whose occupant has visitors. Some patients sit near a fireplace. a male attendant carries a bowl. D) Bottom right, Saint Bridget stands before a Crucifix erected at right, holding a lighted candle. Caption above, at left: "Sta. Brigida."

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Sketchbook Page; Monument of Marcus Aurelius Antonius with Son; Study for an Engraving, ca. 1590; Designed by Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus (Flemish, active in Italy, 1523 – 1605); Netherlands; pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on laid paper; H x W: 14.9 × 10.9 cm (5 7/8 × 4 5/16 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors; 1901-39-142
